gospel.text:
[[Lc 14,15]]One of those at table with Jesus said to him, "Blessed is the one who will dine in the kingdom of God."
[[Lc 14,16]]He replied to him, "A man gave a great dinner to which he invited many.
[[Lc 14,17]]When the time for the dinner came, he dispatched his servant to say to those invited, 'Come, everything is now ready.'
[[Lc 14,18]]But one by one, they all began to excuse themselves. The first said to him, 'I have purchased a field and must go to examine it; I ask you, consider me excused.'
[[Lc 14,19]]And another said, 'I have purchased five yoke of oxen and am on my way to evaluate them; I ask you, consider me excused.'
[[Lc 14,20]]And another said, 'I have just married a woman, and therefore I cannot come.'
[[Lc 14,21]]The servant went and reported this to his master. Then the master of the house in a rage commanded his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in here the poor and the crippled, the blind and the lame.'
[[Lc 14,22]]The servant reported, 'Sir, your orders have been carried out and still there is room.'
[[Lc 14,23]]The master then ordered the servant, 'Go out to the highways and hedgerows and make people come in that my home may be filled.
[[Lc 14,24]]For, I tell you, none of those men who were invited will taste my dinner.'"
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 131,1]]O LORD, my heart is not proud, 
nor are my eyes haughty; 
I busy not myself with great things, 
nor with things too sublime for me.

[[Ps 131,2]]Nay rather, I have stilled and quieted 
my soul like a weaned child. 
Like a weaned child on its mother's lap, 
so is my soul within me.

[[Ps 131,3]]O Israel, hope in the LORD, 
both now and forever.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Rm 12,5]]Brothers and sisters: We, though many, are one Body in Christ and individually parts of one another.
[[Rm 12,6]]Since we have gifts that differ according to the grace given to us, let us exercise them: if prophecy, in proportion to the faith;
[[Rm 12,7]]if ministry, in ministering; if one is a teacher, in teaching;
[[Rm 12,8]]if one exhorts, in exhortation; if one contributes, in generosity; if one is over others, with diligence; if one does acts of mercy, with cheerfulness.
[[Rm 12,9]]Let love be sincere; hate what is evil, hold on to what is good;
[[Rm 12,10]]love one another with mutual affection; anticipate one another in showing honor.
[[Rm 12,11]]Do not grow slack in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.
[[Rm 12,12]]Rejoice in hope, endure in affliction, persevere in prayer.
[[Rm 12,13]]Contribute to the needs of the holy ones, exercise hospitality.
[[Rm 12,14]]Bless those who persecute (you), bless and do not curse them.
[[Rm 12,15]]Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep.
[[Rm 12,16a]]Have the same regard for one another; do not be haughty but associate with the lowly.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
